news_header: A new study predicts nearly half of U.S. adults over 55 will develop dementia, with a significant increase in cases expected by 2060.
news_text: A recent study indicates that nearly 50% of Americans over 55 will develop dementia, with projections suggesting 1 million new cases annually by 2060. This estimate, significantly higher than previous ones, is based on a diverse study group of over 15,000 participants. Factors such as age, gender, and genetics influence risk, but lifestyle changes like improved cardiovascular health and hearing aid use may mitigate some risks.
